detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Political Science, Philosophy and  Economics stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/political-science-philosophy-economics-ppe/. Students must register in both Term 1 and Term 2 courses in CAP. 
 
In addition to this lecture, please register in one of the following discussion sections: POLI_V 101-LX1, POLI_V 101-LX2, POLI_V 101-LX3, POLI_V 101-LX4, POLI_V 101-LX5, or POLI_V 101-LX6. This course is clustered with ECON_V 102-011, and PHIL_V 102-003. For ECON_V 102-011, please register in the lecture and one of the following discussion sections: ECON_V 102-L9A, or ECON_V 102-L9B. For PHIL_V 102-003, please register in the lecture, and PHIL_V 102-L07. Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1-2)  each term. 
 
For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/ 
 
If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
PORT 102 further develops the fundamentals learned in PORT 101. Lessons are focused on slightly more complex grammar structures that enhance the skills. Students are able to apply new communicative skills such as talking about future plans and narrating events in the past.  
 
See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/PORT102/    

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Individual & Society stream,   
https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/individual-society/. Students must register in both Term  
1 and Term 2 courses in CAP. 
 
This course is clustered with ECON_V 102-010, and the Individual & Society sections of the CAP stream seminar CAP_V 101. For CAP_V 101, please register in one of the following: CAP_V 101-I01, CAP_V 101-I02, CAP_V 101-I03, or CAP_V 101-I05. For ECON_V 102-010, please register in the lecture and one of the following discussion sections: ECON_V 102-L8A, or ECON_V 102-L8B. PSYC_V 102-003, and CAP_V 101 do not have any additional discussion sections. Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1-2) each term. 
 
For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/ 
 
If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
